intro: Veronica alpina var. geminiflora, commonly known as the Alpine speedwell, is a flowering plant native to alpine regions of Europe and Asia. It is a low-growing perennial with slender stems and small, blue or violet flowers that bloom in summer. The plant features lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, white pubescence. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments. Its flowers are typically arranged in pairs, giving it the species name "geminiflora," meaning "two-flowered."
